Reviews.Title: “Convenient, courteous, free shuttle, not fancy”
Reviews.Author: OpenToNewAdventures
Reviews.Content: Great proximity to the airport & a good "package" for a shuttle and free parking during the time away. Absolutely no complaints about all that. Good shuttle drivers. Reliable. Prompt. The rooms, however, are quite dated. If you want a bare-bones room, this place is fine. Our room was quite dated. It was clean, but pretty minimal in terms of comfort. If you want more amenities and comfort, this might not be your best choice. For a good shuttle service and free parking during your time away, it's great.

Reviews.Title: “My stay was great”
Reviews.Author: Salewa O
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel march 9-12 check in was a breeze I did ask for a room on west wing other patrons advised me to do so my room number 280 king bed very nice it is a sleep number bed kinda hard but ez to adjust. I was skepical having read the other reviews on here and honestly i dont know y everyone is so down on this property. The ice machine doesnt work on 2nd floor but it does on 3 the pop machine is 2$ it woulda been nice to have a snack machine as well. I asked for late checkout at 1pm was granted no problem at all the decor was nice renovated def a 3 *** hotel. Free newspapers during weekday free tootbrush i left mine at home. The tub is small so if ur a bigger person its hard fit the water pressure was low and the shower ever got hot like i wanted it to. The view out window was horrid roof but i only slept in hotel so no problem for me. Housekeeping starts at 8am and u do hear them parking was free location out of the way nothing nearby at all. Restaurant on premises is pricey no free breakfast never heard any planes i swear i forgot this was supposed to be near airport. Overall nice experience and i would def stay again. P.S. I booked on priceline $40 a nite cant beat it

Reviews.Title: “Nice room. Rest of property needs update.”
Reviews.Author: shiny62
Reviews.Content: The room was pretty nice. The rest of the property needs some updating. The guest rooms are not close to the front desk. It is a walk past the convention center to get to the rooms. There were a lot of Fed Ex planes landing just over the parking lot at night (would be fun for kids to watch).

Reviews.Title: “Old and noisy”
Reviews.Author: MBabz10
Reviews.Content: Not the best Radisson I have stayed at. They advertised that they have updated the property, but the interiors were poorly maintained. The roon was also terribly loud, with planes landing until 11:30pm or so. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “At least the shuttle is convenient.”
Reviews.Author: TonyJxx
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the positive, Checking in was quick, simple, and friendly. Next the proximity to the airport and highway is fantastic. The free shuttle and short travel time to the airport is also amazing, and for $5 a day you can leave your car at the hotel while you are gone and save some cash on parking. As for the rest of our stay I don't have many positives, the room was dirty like it hadn't been vacuumed in the past several stays, the paint in the shower was peeling, the bathroom was almost too small to be functional, it too was dirty which was unsettling. The sleep number bed was awful since it was broken and was stuck on the hardest setting. The fan in the room was really loud, but necessary to block out outside noise. I would recommend this hotel only to people who don't mind dirt much and are staying for one night to utilize the shuttle and cheap parking to fly out in the morning. One night is not worth more than $70. This hotel needs a remodel bad.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel for Airport Access”
Reviews.Author: joarus
Reviews.Content: I just needed a place to stay for an early morning flight. This place, although somewhat dated, was perfectly nice. The room was large with a flat screen tv, clean and comfortable. The staff at checkin was particularly friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, dirty hotel, firmly set in the 1960's”
Reviews.Author: PBRD
Reviews.Content: From the moment one walks into the shabby lobby and is greeted by the none-too-friendly Front Desk associates, the sense of impending doom is palpable. There are no surprises, just affirmation of those original thoughts when staying in a room. Clearly, this is the Radisson that both time and head office forgot. Threadbare sheets, graying/off white towels, blood stains on the bathroom floor. Orange 1960's carpeting with a biology labs worth of germs and stains on it. Thin walls, make it virtually impossible to sleep, in fact, it almost becomes stalking, when, it is apparent that every word can be heard from a conversation in the adjoining room. Bathroom is something out of the Smithsonian, and as other reviewers have commented upon, dirty. There is absolutely nothing to recommend this property. If you have to spend a night at an airport hotel, and the other options are sold out, the terminal would be a more preferable choice.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: mcesparky
Reviews.Content: Light bulbs burned out in rm, electrical plugins in bathroom not working, bathroom fan not working, holes in shower curtain, sleep number bed kept deflating, no working ice makers except in bar. Custodian replaced bulbs also reported no BR fans, or icemakers in bldg working. Supposedly hotel undergoing renovation but none visible. Have never wrote review before but this was bad enough to warrant one....go somewhere else, also there was no satisfaction surveys available to be filled out.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic All Around”
Reviews.Author: dougers79
Reviews.Content: I read some of the reviews of this hotel and I was nervous. I don't know if there has been a drastic change but I couldn't find a single thing wrong with this hotel. Check in was a breeze and the staff was very friendly. I asked for a king size bed and they were super accomadating. She also gave a lot of detail about restaurant and shuttle:-) The room was lovely. Very clean and well maintained. I was pleased with the sleep number bed and the ample pillows that were provided. The linens and towels were great quality and made the comfort level very high! I found the location to be very convinient. I also was impressed with the restaurant and their pricing was very reasonable!! I would stay here again in a heartbeat. They were a hit with me in every way:-)

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly acceptable”
Reviews.Author: JBeanie
Reviews.Content: I was in Indy for a two day conference in the north suburbs and Pricelined a 3 star hotel. After I got this one and read some of the reviews, I was all ready to find fault with it. But I can honestly say it's a perfectly decent hotel - aside from the fact that it's nowhere near where I'm spending my days but that's the risk you take with Priceline. Indy is so bizarrely spread out that it seems like you have to drive forever to get across town. I bid $40 and with taxes paid about $54. It's a little older hotel but has modern, dark wood furniture, a nice deep red color wall and carpet, and the room was large and overall fairly attractive, with a flat screen TV and lots of cable channels. I figured they would stick the Priceliners in an older room but I didn't. It is true that some parts of this place could use a fresh coat of paint ... it's located adjacent to a now-closed airport terminal and obviously would have been a hopping place in its heyday. There's a standard hotel bar and a restaurant ... nothing else over here except a Crowne Plaza hotel next door. I didn't really care that much - I just wanted to hole up early and watch movies. The front desk gals were very nice and sweet. The Internet was great, started right up with no need for a password. The towels were pretty thick and soft. I was traveling solo and got a two bed room - one of the beds was firm, the other was, strangely, busted up or something because it was really soft and moved around like a waterbed. Being someone who likes a very soft mattress, I slept fine on that one. I couldn't figure out how to activate the sleep number thing so didn't. Also, I had my car so brought my own sleeping bag and pillows and towels in case the linens were gross - they weren't, and I didn't use my own stuff. The room and bathroom was very clean. All in all, really decent for the price. Next time, I think I would just wait til I got here and find a new Microtel or something closer to where I need to be so I wouldn't have to drive all over the place. But aside from location -- again, a Priceline issue and my not understanding what a sprawling city this is -- I was really pretty happy with the Radisson. Airplanes do fly over but there wasn't any noise that bothered me. Accessibility was fine too - it's right off 465, easy to find. It's really close to the airport that is in service, if that's what you're looking for, and the desk lady said the shuttle runs 24 hours a day, every half hour.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly good stay, HUGE room”
Reviews.Author: Susan C
Reviews.Content: I booked a room through priceline so I ended up not getting any reward points for it, but it was still a good pitstop on our trip. I was headed to a conference in Chicago but the drive was too long to make it in one trip so we opted to stay in Indianapolis for one night. We arrived at 11pm and left at 8am so I can't comment on much of the extras of the hotel. The front desk was very nice and changed my room from 2 double beds to a single king size bed. I know it's something they would rather do anyway but what I was surprised with was the absolutely ginormous size of the room. It's the same as the person who posted about being the Guest of the Day room. I took pictures but it's easy enough to see it with the other reviewers pictures. It could have been easily split into 2 rooms. The tv was very nice and I loved the large soaps. My boyfriend didn't like the shampoo/conditioner (I used my own) but the bath soap was great. It had bumps on it for massaging purposes. Unlike other hotels, the bath soap and the facial soap was made of different materials. I contemplated on taking the rest of it with me but I didn't have a zip lock bag. Now the cons of it. The shower head was new and was one of those large head rain drop type but it was not screwed in stably into the wall. I felt like I was going to yank it off the wall when I moved it up. I'm also not from around here so I was not used to the taste of the water.. I would bring bottled water next time. The couch was a bit old with some stains and patches but the rest of the furniture was very nice (coffee table, desk, chair, tv, tv stand, huge bed). I did find quite a lot of brown thin hair on the bed. It was on the sheet, the top sheet, the comforter, the pillows, etc. I could not tell if they just rearranged it or actually washed anything. I also found a single flea crawling on me. I didn't find anymore and my boyfriend didn't get any bites so I believe it was just a single incident. I meant to bring the flea we killed to the front desk when we were checking out but we forgot about it. Our room was right next to the elevator. The front desk lady took a while to try to find a room away from elevator traffic so it was around the corner but we could hear it go up and down all night long. It wasn't loud enough to wake me up but did take longer to fall asleep. I didn't hear any planes until we were already up anyway. Breakfast was not included (I seemed to have missed this when booking). I wish it were especially with it being an airport hotel. Otherwise, the stay was fairly good.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews at this site and others, I was hesitant to make a reservation at this hotel but I went ahead made a reservation. I was pleasantly surprised. We stayed at this hotel for one night. This was our first time at this hotel. Our room was on the 6th floor. Ownership: This hotel is not owned by Radisson or operated by Radisson. It is a franchisee. Front Desk – Check In: There were no issues. They allowed us to check in early. Front Desk - Service: The service was outstanding. Internet Service: I connected to the wireless network in the room without any issues. Location: The location of the hotel was very good for us based upon our itinerary for our trip. We had an early morning flight (5:50 AM) so decided to select an airport hotel with a shuttle service. Shuttle Service: It was on time. The driver was very helpful with our luggage. Room – Outdoor Noise: We didn’t hear any airplane noise. AC\Heat: The heat and air conditioning is individually controlled by a thermostat on the wall. We had no problem with the AC\Heat. Bed: The bed was comfortable. Room: The design, décor, etc. of the room was average. Bathroom (Tub and Toilet): The size of the bathroom was on the small size (only one person in the bathroom at a time). TV: The TV was a flat screen. There were ports for us to attach our digital cameras to review pictures that we took during our trip. Parking: There is plenty of parking at the hotel. Value: We paid $ 79.20 a night plus taxes which we considered to be a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Facilities OK, nothing special. Some employees rude, inept, other great.”
Reviews.Author: adcjones
Reviews.Content: Had my wedding here. Had family stay at hotel. Facilities were ok. Nothing special. Nothing bad. Bathrooms very outdated, small. Not very close to anything except airport. Some staff were superb, front desk people rude, some very strange and creepy. No pool by the way.

Reviews.Title: “Very handy to IND”
Reviews.Author: 2Midwest
Reviews.Content: Had a 6am flight so spent the night here the night before the flight. The room was newly remodelled. Clean. No complaints. Nice TV. $2 for chips in the vending machine seemed high. Shuttle right on time at 430am on a Sunday morning. Closest hotel to the airport. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: Traveler4446
Reviews.Content: Overall, I would not recommend this hotel. The rooms are old fashion. They have old school handles on the toielets and the rooms have old school tvs, not flat screen, and the carpets in room are badly stained. More importantly, the Front desk staff is the worst that I have experienced. I am a goldpoints gold member, but because I booked through priceline they insisted that all benefits for being a loyal guest were null and they could only give me rooms on the back side of hotel. I had to switch my room 3 times to find one that was half decent. I worked with Jessica and Amanda, and they seemed to find my issue amusing. Hopefully, this hotel can better train it's staff and make some renovations to rooms. At this point, there are better options in the area for similar price. Hyatt place and wydham are other options, and much better.

Reviews.Title: “Advoid at all costs!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nick S
Reviews.Content: Filthy room torn curtains shower faucet didn`t work no ac on 3rd floor hallways torn dirty carpeting. Mr Wright manager failed to return calls or respond to email corporate office could care less.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tjordan38
Reviews.Content: The hotel was next to the airport. This is a large hotel to accomodate many travelers. This is conveniently located next to the major airport. This is ideal for large group trip. The rooms were clean and the room was not updated to a trendy look but had a comfortable sleep number beds. I actually stayed at this hotel on the way to my destination and also on the return home due to a good deal on priceline.com. The rooms on the east side of the airport are loud with airplane traffic. The room on the west was quiet. If you would stay at this hotel, you would want to request a room on the west side of the building. The hotel is large and would make a huge diffrence. The service from the staff was awesome. They were efficient when checking in and very polite and friendly. It did not provide a quick start breakfast. Other hotels would add this with this type of hotel for the price. Over all it was a nice and clean hotel. I would stay at this hotel again. .

Reviews.Title: “stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: rls43623
Reviews.Content: Cut my finger on jagged edged desk chair...noisy, near runway...maids don't pay attention to the do not disturb sign...cable and internet down (was told it would be fixed tomorrow!) For a business hotel, there can't have failing internet! Stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience for our group”
Reviews.Author: Overthet0p
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very accommodating for a large group, enjoyed the staff, the newly renovated hotel rooms, and food and beverage services.

Reviews.Title: “Totally enjoyed our stay and will look into Radisson's for future trips!”
Reviews.Author: ehumphrey85
Reviews.Content: This was my boyfriend's first trip to Indianapolis my millionth and while we were driving, I noticed we may come close to missing our check out. I called the hotel to confirm our reservation and to prepare them for a possible late arrival. Everything was confirmed and our late arrival was noted. When we arrived at the hotel and walked into the lobby and beautiful "GUEST OF THE DAY" sign with decoration was sitting at the desk. I was so shocked - i took a picture! We were upgraded to a suite where we were able to relax and enjoy our own space yet still being together. The Sleep Number bed was magnificant and I'm looking into getting one. The room was right by the elevator and directly next to the ice machine. We had everything we needed and I'm so glad I chose the Radisson for our trip. The only negative thing is we wish someone would have told us about the heavy construction sourrounding the hotel. However, we will definitely look into Radisson's for future trips. The entire trip from booking to checking in was perfect and very inexpensive! Thanks TripAdvisor.com!!

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay before boarding plane”
Reviews.Author: kreeves2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson Hotel Indianapolis Airport and paid to leave my car there while I went on a week trip to Florida. The staff was extremely nice. The room was very clean. The hotel is showing it's age, but I really don't have any complaints. The shuttle service to and from the airport was perfect and picked me back up in a timely manner when I returned. The guy working the bar (in the middle of the week) was working hard taking care of the bar, doing food orders and taking food up to peoples rooms. I guess when it is a slow night (Monday night) the hotel has to save where they can so this guy had many jobs...but was very pleasant and tried to be very attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Great changes”
Reviews.Author: colettep69
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before, and it was a pretty bad stay. After seeing that this hotel has been renovated and that the price is right, I tried it again and the changes are very noticeable. The room was outstanding, and so was the staff. I encountered one small issue and it was resolved immediately and in a fashion far beyond my expectations. Location isn't great, but shuttle service is available. For the price, this place can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: NathanLipps
Reviews.Content: I was in town for business and it was great. The staff was very helpful and the room was very clean. I will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful staff throughout the hotel ... amazing”
Reviews.Author: 34515Charlotte
Reviews.Content: The hotel has been recently updated and all was fine but the staff at this hotel should be at the best hotels in America! They assisted me with every request over a very busy weekend ... INDY 500! The room cleaners were friendly, the van drivers friendly, the front desk staff friendly and yes even the restaurant staff was friendly!

Reviews.Title: “We had a good stay here”
Reviews.Author: KMR2009
Reviews.Content: In town for the Indy Pace Car Reunion and stayed here. Have to agree with some other reviewers who said it is a bit hard to find...lots of road construction for sure but you can't fault the hotel for that as I'm sure it is frustrating for them too. Our room was clean. Was missing a few picky things...there was no luggage rack (but we called down for 1 and it was brought up right away), no TV channel guide (they have them at the front desk) and no information about the hotel. You know how you go to some hotels and there is a little binder on the desk with restaurant times, lounge times, maybe a room service menu...that would have been helpful to have. Little details that would have been nice but didn't make me hate it there. Staff were all very nice and extremely helpful and flexible. You do get some airport noise...planes fly overhead quite a bit...but it wasn't all that bad. We didn't notice much noise from the adjoining rooms...but had our AC on most of the time we were in the room which may have made a difference. Can't really complain about anything!

Reviews.Title: “Hard-to-find and very noisy”
Reviews.Author: esj_in_ohio
Reviews.Content: The airport has a new terminal, but this Radisson is right next to the old one, which is closed and vacant. It is hard to get to by car because of highway construction in the area, which has closed a lot of interchanges. The worst part, though, is that the rooms have no soundproofing whatsoever. Conversations and TV in the next room can be heard clearly. My wife says she heard the guest in the next room unwrapping a bar of soap in the bathroom through the wall! The hotel is clean and safe, and we got a great rate, but the noise was really a problem.

Reviews.Title: “A mistake I won't make again”
Reviews.Author: Travler1888
Reviews.Content: Whatever you do don't stay at the Indianapolis Airport Radisson. This facility needs to be torn down and rebuilt. Condition of facility both inside and outstide is marginal. Carpet in the hallway was patched with duct tape. Sink in the bathroom was pulling away from the wall. Hallway and room just smelled old and musty. The experienced reminded me of a facility that had been ridden hard and put away wet. I will avoid Radisson hotels for fear that a second stay would be a repeat of a marginal experience at best. The value for the money was not there.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel, but otherwise bad location”
Reviews.Author: JlginPHX
Reviews.Content: I stayed in April 2011 and the lobby and room were newly renovated. everything was clean and fresh. If you are coming or going to the airport, this would be a good bet (it is located on the far side of the airport by the old terminal). However the location is not great if you are looking for a extended visit to town with access to other attractions, dining, etc.

Reviews.Title: “The worst place in this trip...”
Reviews.Author: Ignaciocl
Reviews.Content: Bad bad service, Customers are the last important thing for these people, shuttle from the airport has to be called first, shuttle in the morning to the airport has to be booked! For the time we need was full since..they suggest us to get up half hour before! No restaurant at 10 pm, no breakfast al 5:30am, bar doesn't have any snack with The drinks....or the guy didn't bring us any! Really bad, specially compares with the Hilton at Wichita where we stayed yesterday

Reviews.Title: “Rundown Motel...gritty feel”
Reviews.Author: hazother1
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to this stay especially since I got a great deal through name your price on priceline. Well, 1st looks are really good. Entryway and staff and 5 star. At first glance the rest of the hotel looks great. BUT when you start looking closer you see that the hotel is in desperate need of repair. Here's a list: room outlets push into the wall and "spit" out your cords after a while [sleep number beds didn't work because of this], no working bathroom fan, broken glass on stairwell floor because of broken exit sign, above closet door there's an exposed 6 foot strip of 2x4, at floor level there were 2 broken wall pieces that opened up the wall, sink handles were stripped and could be turned both ways, bath faucet collar could just spin around, shower water pressure was basically a trickle, etc. Also when we physically turned the switch on lights, they felt gritty. My wife slept in her pajama bottoms due to the "uncleanly" feel.... there goes my fun night......Walls were very thin, plus you can hear every single plane that lands and takes off. The view is nice if you like watching planes as the airport is literally 500 feet from your window. Sure the hotel may say they are remodeling/renovating but I definitely don't see any signs of it. Just disrepair. I hope Radisson isn't going down the toilet, but by the looks of this hotel....it probably will.

Reviews.Title: “AC unit caught on fire & smoke detector never went off!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ajkke
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed overnight in your hotel along with some friends of ours... Around 1am we heard the AC unit make a loud buzzing noise & then a very foul smell that reminded us of an oven being cleaned. My husband got out of bed and walked over to the unit & it started big time sparking (like fireworks)!!!  Our room had smoke in it & he told me and our young daughters to get out of the room, about that time it stopped for a short second as the girls & I were getting up to leave then it started sparking 10x's more & it caught on fire!!!  My husband was able to put it out, by beating it with a towel. We called the front desk & they brought us a room key for another room that was down the hall. Needless to say, we were all very  shook up over this & I had to calm my girls down to get them to sleep. I however was not able to sleep!  My biggest complaint with this situation is that our smoke detector never went off!!!  We had plenty of smoke in our room, there is no reason it didn't go off!! I was also a little upset with the lack of concern of the staff, they of course did say they were sorry but acted very nonchalant about it. As we checkout the next morning the gentleman who check us out ask how our stay was... I replied it was good, except for the FIRE!!  He too was nonchalant in my opinion with his reply that he had heard about that, but they switched us rooms right away & took care of it. He also stated that the unit was now fixed, which I don't believe to be true, b/c as we were on our way to check out, I stopped by the room (the door was propped open) & I seen tools & pieces of the unit on the floor!?! All in all, I was very upset about the smoke detector the most, b/c had we been asleep I hate to think of what might have happened!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disorganized but not all bad.”
Reviews.Author: jgflys
Reviews.Content: We booked this last minute as a park and fly deal. The room was only $59 for the night which I thought with the shuttle and free parking was a steal. The rooms here are coming along. The place is under a remodel so I didn't expect much. It has potential to be a nice hotel but its going to need some pep talks here and there. The front desk was unorganized. They didnt even know if our room was clean or not. The front desk girl was on her cell phone. The biggest draw back staying here was the beds. The ad makes is sound like select comfort sleep number beds, Thats not in every room. Ours sure didnt have one. We slept on a sheet of plywood that night. At least thats what it felt like. Other than that its all you should expect from a $59.00 stay.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveler33337093
Reviews.Content: This is not a Radisson hotel. It definitely is not. Its feeling is cheaper than a motel. Small dingy room with a dingy bathroom. I had never had such a cheap feeling in my life. When I called this Radisson to make a reservation for one night business tip, I thought I was getting a great deal. I should have picked up Motel 6 instead. Pros: 1. Free high speed internet that actually works 2. Free parking 3. Very friendly front-desk staff Cons: 1. Very old hotel in a bad shape 2. Rooms are very small 3. Bathrooms are tiny 4. AC made a lot of noise 5. Paper thin walls. When my neighbor got a wake-up call at 4am in the morning, I thought my phone was ringing. Walls are VERY VERY thin 6. If you are not used to the sleep number beds, good luck because you would have a hard time sleeping in them 7. Parking lot was full of frozen ice. The least the hotel could do is clean the ice or use ice melt. Could tell it was a cheap hotel Overall, a very bad experience. Please do not waste your time with this hotel even if you get to stay here for free.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is in bad shape”
Reviews.Author: Indy-Eliz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel and it was in very bad shape. There are renovations going on but the existing rooms are very run down. The tile work in the bathrooms is cracked and broken, the doors don't close all the way unless closed very hard. A few in our group had money stolen (they completed a police report). The few out our window to the abandoned airport was as depressing as the room. The one bright spot was the Sleep Number bed. The toilet ran (and it was very old style handle) with run down decor and no place for toiletries on the vanity. On the positive side, it seemed clean.

Reviews.Title: “What an awful experience. Will NEVER use this hotel again!”
Reviews.Author: cgsr3
Reviews.Content: Made a reservation by phone, and was told that breakfast was included in my price. Received an email confirmation of this, but when I arrived, this was not honored. Was not treated with respect, and the group that I traveled with was not treated well. Our group will most likely be traveling to Indy again, but will stay far away from this hotel. Too many bad experience during this trip to list.

Reviews.Title: “no hot water..construction mess”
Reviews.Author: nicholena
Reviews.Content: This hotel is impossible to reach with construction everywhere. The rooms are dingy,beds uncomfortable,but the last straw is the lukewarm water in the showers. The sinks have tons of hot,but the showers none. We were in a group that had eight rooms booked and they were all the same.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to airport, property under renovation”
Reviews.Author: chai2girl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for less than 12 hours so I can't speak to the property generally or service other than check-in. I booked this room through Hotels.com and the check-in process was very smooth and fast. The front desk clerk was very friendly. As I walked down the hall to my room (4th or 5th floor), I had an odd feeling as many doors were ajar and one room was filled (literally) with pillows and blankets. When I got to my room the door was slightly ajar (propped open by the security latch) as many others had been and there was a note that the property was under renovation and the "old" rooms were being offered at a discount (which I assume was why it was offered through Hotels.com). So, other than the disquieting feeling from finding my room open, it was fine for a quick overnight. There was a sleep-by-numbers bed. There was some visible dust on the desk which I assume was related to the renovations. I only heard one or two airplanes in the time I was there (11 pm - 5 am). I did not hear a lot of noise from the hall but I don't think there were many occupied rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Under new management”
Reviews.Author: 2Midwest
Reviews.Content: This hotel is under new management. The first room they gave me needed vacuming. The next room was clean. Older property in so so shape but under renovation. Staff was very friendly and professional. Room was quiet until 5am when runway departures were loud. The hotel is no longer close to the new terminal but there aren't any closer hotels. Easy access from Sam Jones expressway. Free or 5 dollar a day parking a plus. Recommended before a flight.

Reviews.Title: “Don't judge a hotel by it's online pics”
Reviews.Author: RhondaRhonda
Reviews.Content: I had a business meeting in Indy and booked a room at the Indy Radisson, through Expe***. I used to live in the Indy area and had been to a couple of conferences at the Radisson. The lobby, restaurant and pub decor were nice, so I thought I could expect the same when it came to the cleanliness and decor of the rooms. Checked in and went to the room where I was expecting the King sleep-number that was selected on Exp***, only to discover there were 2 doubles and no sleep number. I called the front desk and they said - "You booked on Exp***, so it's whatever we have available"..... Here were some of the issues....a few squares of toilet tissue left...with no extra rolls in the room, vent cover to bathroom was laying on floor, wallpaper was moldy, smoke detector was missing from wall - but wires were still there, curtains had water stains, paint was peeling off of ceiling in multiple places....and so on. You'd be better off booking somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “some good, some bad...................”
Reviews.Author: HeyNow99
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very well suited to our needs. Location is OK and the 24 hr shuttle was handy, but the area seems abandoned since the airport terminal has moved. People were helpful, but the hotel is tired and showing its age. We had two rooms and one was OK but the other was very musty and damp. The TV system felt like it was from the 80's and the room is just very dated. The only busy part of the deal is all the air traffic from Fed-Ex that come directly over the hotel for several hours in the evening.. Looks like they are trying to gets things updated, but it may be a tough deal to get done. The lobby was fine, but did not see a single person in the bar or restaurant during our 2 night stay. Its one of those deals where if I paid rack rate, I would be very upset, but since it was a Priceline deal it was tolerable. The hotel was fine for our needs, but not for its star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Brewster626
Reviews.Content: I work for a medium size company and several of us travel often. With the current economic situation, we try to limit our travel expenses as much as possible. Indy is a new area for us and when I booked this stay at such a great rate...I was a little concerned...as I always am when visiting a new city. I was certainly very pleasantly surprised ! It is so convenient to the airport with free shuttle service. I was even able to delay picking up my rental car until the next morning which saved more $$. Their shuttle took me back to the airport to get a car. Much easier than dealing with it when I arrived at the airport at 9:30 at night. An easy 10 minute drive to downtown where I was meeting our clients. The staff was so friendly, very professional. The Sleep Number bed was a nice feature, the room was nice, great fluffy bedspread and really soft sheets. I had breakfast in the restaurant...and guess what...the oatmeal was "homemade"...not that microwave instant stuff you usually get...trust me, you can tell the difference. The server told me that all of their selections are homemade, not pre-made. This Radisson is my new home when I'm in Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “It's a good deal”
Reviews.Author: aveclesfilles
Reviews.Content: I was a guest at the Radisson from July 7th until July 10th. Truth be told I was a little nervous after reading some of the reviews on here, but it wasn't as bad as some are making it out to be. First off it's very easy to find from the airport and is right off the 465. Check in was a breeze and only took a couple of moments. So now it was the moment of truth, Room 550, what was I getting myself into? The room was just fine and very clean. I was at the end of the hall and heard no noise during my stay. I'm not sure if I actually had the sleep number bed, but I managed to sleep just fine with or without it. Yes the bathroom is a little bit small, but it was clean so I was happy. If you are an above average height then the shower might be a bit of a squeeze but it allowed me to practice my limbo moves. The only thing that I felt the room was really missing was a hotel binder of the amenities. I don't know if the other rooms have one, but I certainly didn't and I would have found this useful. On my last night of my visit I experienced some water issues and the front desk was less than helpful with this issue. First off they didn't answer the phone until I called the on duty manager number and then I received the ever so useful excuse of 'we are really busy'. When I explained the problem of having no hot water and the fact that the water was brown she said she would call me back, which she did. However she was trying to radio with maintenance and couldn't seem to figure out the radio so she placed me on hold.....for over 3 minutes. Dave the maintenance man then showed up at my door explaining that a water main had burst that day across the street so that's why there were water issues. He was most helpful and after I explained my dissatisfaction with the front desk Dave apologized for them and for the hotel. I found Dave's apology very sincere. Overall this hotel doesn't deserve the bad reviews it's been receiving. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again if I find myself in Indianapolis. It's clean, quiet and overall it's a well maintained property.

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating”
Reviews.Author: lori0422
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson for one night on our way to Pittsburgh -- just needed a comfortable sleep after a day of driving and a good shower the next day. I was looking forward to trying a Sleep Number bed, but wasn't impressed -- it just felt lumpy! My husband and I both slept badly. When I took a shower, I had to bend way down to get under the shower head (it was a good eight inches below the top of my head -- I'm only 5'11''.) The room was clean, though, and the front desk staff was friendly. Even so, probably won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff. Nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: drhall
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this hotel. It is a little bit older and has some character. The rooms were very clean and the staff was polite and conversational. The only drawback (for some) was that there were few amenities in the bathroom. But, I would definitely stay there again. It's located right next to the airport, and is about ten minutes from downtown by expressway.

Reviews.Title: “Just the girls getaway”
Reviews.Author: Johnswife_10
Reviews.Content: My gal pals and i got away from the kids, the dogs and the husbands for a weekend. We stayed at the Radisson Hotel by the airport here in Indianapolis. What a delightful stay!! We wanted someplace where we felt secure, welcomed and special. This hotel did all that. From the people in Austin;s bar to the girl at the desk, all were very nice and accommodating. We laughed and joked til all hours, the food, beverage and service were all outstanding. I believe we have found a diamond in our little corner of the world. Touche'

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Musiclover086
Reviews.Content: Wow, we had a great time. Some friends and I went to Indianapolis to do some recon work for a group of us wanting to go down for the Indianapolis 500. We happened upon this Radisson by the airport, how very convenient. The rooms were nice and the restaurant and bar area was great. We had alot of fun with both the bartenders and the other folks drinking in the bar. The beautiful exercise room and the shuttle means we will be back and have already booked our stay for the race.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Closetoret
Reviews.Content: This Radisson was nicely located near the airport and offered shuttle service. I had come into town for a meeting and had alot of work to do. The desk area in the room, the free wireless and the helpfulness of the desk staff may my stay great. I accomplished everything that I needed to and had a nice space in which to work and relax. The next time i have chance to be in Indianapolis, this will be my hotel. Keep up the great job!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: catz9200
Reviews.Content: My room was very clean and comfortable and I loved the Sleep Number Bed. The bar and restaurant staff were friendly and seemed eager to accommodate their guests. All the staff were freindly and this was a perfect hotel for business.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location below average accomodations”
Reviews.Author: SoccermommaAmie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location easy access on and off the highway, to the airport as well as to the speedway. Now with that being said, the hotel itself is below average on cleanliness, the carpet in our room was stained, the showerhead was so terrible and the water pressure was even worse not to mention it was one extreme or the other either freezing or scalding hot there just wasn't any way to get the water a moderate temperature to take a comfortable shower. Now the beds by far were the worst part of the stay, they were sleep number beds and just to say if you are a sleep number fan you will probably love it but if you are not just be forewarned all their beds are sleep numbers and with as many guest as I am sure they have there my guess is these beds do not operate properly. They were either rock hard or when you let enough air out to get them comfortable you sank into the middle of the mattress and then hours later the pump would kick on and air back up by itself to rock hard again. All 4 people in our party agreed (myself mid 30's, my husband late 30's our 15 y/o and my mother in her mid 50's) they were the most uncomfortable beds we had EVER slept on in our lives! The ice machine was broken on our floor so we had to go down to the 5th floor to make the trek just to get ice. There is a restaurant but they cut off room service at 10pm every night which doesn't help becuase there isn't really anything close by to run and grab a bite from when you arrive at 10:20 as we did. Like I said the location is good but would probably not stay here again knowing I wouldn't sleep a wink in the beds and the next morning just trying to shower was a challenge.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy”
Reviews.Author: pipewoman40
Reviews.Content: Took my husband here for his birthday where we were led to believe all rooms had the sleep number bed not true ours had the bed no controllers & front desk didn't seem to care too much. Also website says they have a place called "the Corner Store" where you can find things that you may have forgotten. Uh oh another misconception. They haven't had the store for some time now. Get it off your website then!!!! Very misleading. They are very reserved on handing out any shampoo or soap. Most of all NO WATER PRESSURE what so ever!! Lastly a school of teenage band members stayed & slammed doors & roamed the halls til 2a not good when you are looking to relax!! I would definately give this hotel a big thumbs down!!! & a huge SUCKS!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: Chadwic7795
Reviews.Content: Checked in at midnight after a very long 24 hour day of working. Walked nearly a country mile to get to my room. Passed a wedding reception letting out, full of drunk obnoxious people crowding the hallways. Tried to shower and get some sleep, there was NO WATER PRESSURE! Tried to lay down, had sleep number beds, but I found 2 dirty socks in my bed!!! Horrible housekeeping! If I had not have been awake for 24 hours already I would have just left. Had a terrible stay, not to mention the people in the rooms next to me were in and out all night long making all kinds of noise.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant suprise”
Reviews.Author: IndianaSheri_F
Reviews.Content: I was not particularly happy to win this hotel on priceline, given some of the reviews. I was pleasantly surprised. The service at the front desk was very prompt and courteous. There was a bellman that helped us bring our luggage to our room. I did not request but received adjoining rooms. I did call before arrival and request if I could have 2 beds per room, and they did meet that request. The rooms were very clean, and I admit I'm pretty picky. The rooms we stayed in did look recently updated. The beds and linens were comfortable (sleep number beds). Plenty of pillows. Internet was free. Bathrooms were spotless. Hairdryer available on the wall in the bathroom, I prefer a moveable one, but it worked well. Temperature in the room stayed even all night. Being so close to the airport, you do hear some noise from airplanes in the early morning. This was ok with us, as we were there to get up very early anyway and catch a flight ourselves. There is a free shuttle at this hotel to the airport which we used, they were very quick and polite. You can park onsite for long term for 10.00 per 24 hours. We did take advantage of that offer. In the morning when we left the lobby had a small selection of pastry, muffins and fruit. Do not be afraid to stay here! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: letsgo36
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night while in town on business. Chose this hotel for two reasons: close to the location of my conference & the great rate I got on this hotel thru Expedia. Room was clean, nice Select Number king bed, and the waitress in the restaurant at breakfast was very friendly & efficient. The front desk personnel were not overly friendly. Of course, since it was near the airport, it was noisy in early evening & early morning. The room was clean but dark, even with 4 lamps lit, and the air conditioner unit was noisy. The room was either hot or too cold after running it for a while. The place is obviously older, & could use some upkeep/update, but it was clean & room was good size. It is "average", low 3-star rating by my estimation, but for the price was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, especially for price”
Reviews.Author: tucker81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on Thursday evening & then again on Sunday evening to make commute to/from airport easier. First night, the room was small and the bathroom basically had no counter space at all - just a single sink. On Sunday night, we got a room with better bath, but front desk didn't honor our reservation for a king bed - said none were available and was quite rude about it. A/C didn't work in that room very well and room smelled like mildew - i promptly got a couple upon returning home. They charged us $111 the first night and $141 the second - can't understand the difference for a Sunday evening. Wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I was surprised by all the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: PattyPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: My husband was meeting a group of antique collectors at this hotel for a three day meeting and I went along. Before we left, I checked out the reviews and I was scared! The Radisson is not all sparkley and crisp and new and yes, a bit of updating wouldn't hurt. If you are used to the Westin or Lowes, or other really sharp hotels, you will probably not like this hotel. But it was clean, the food was great, and the service of each person who worked there was amazing. People were super friendly and went out of their way . I like that kind of customer service. We had 6 banquet meals there--lunches and dinners- and the staff was wonderful and the food was great. There is a little bar in the hotel and Lilay, the bartender makes a great vodka martini! This hotel has the sleep number bed. I was not impressed, but it was comfortable.(I was expecting lots of variation with the numbers from the radio ads but there is not much difference from 65 to 90 ) One thing I did not like was the flourescent bulbs in all the lights in the room. That gave it an unnecessarily dingy look. They only gave us shampoo and a bar of soap. No shower cap, lotion or conditioner. Not a big deal, but it would have been nice. If like me you are there with a spouse who has things to do, avail yourself to a great day spa called the Mystique about a 10 minute drive away on Rockville Road .You will need a car probably, but the hotel offers shuttle service and I bet they would take you. There is also a nice fitness center. It has the same type of treadmill as my gym at home plus a good stair stepper and free weights and an eliptical of good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good value.”
Reviews.Author: athenian01
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel with friends. You can tell the hotel is in need of some updating, but is still very nice. Elevators were in need of work. Well appointed lobby, nicely decorated rooms. Great value, I think we payed around $40. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good room for the price”
Reviews.Author: Springfield6677
Reviews.Content: I recently attended the Indianapolis 500 race and stayed at the hotel both Saturday and Sunday nights. I booked the hotel thru priceline, then read the reviews. I was pleasantly pleased when we arrived. I was expecting much worse from the reviews. The hotel was older, but it had pretty much what we needed. A clean room and bed. I paid $75 a night thru priceline and would have paid much more for motel 6 on race weekend. So we were very pleasantly pleased with our experience. If you are coming to a race and have a car to get to the track this may be the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad, and the location.”
Reviews.Author: orlandoauction
Reviews.Content: I landed this room on priceline for $70. I stayed on a Friday night. Then I read the reviews regarding the location and the age of the hotel. I was seriously worried. Unfounded for the most part. The hotel is old. Concrete structure like they built in the 70's. Concrete painted ceilings. The location, yes, the side of airport the hotel is located on is completely closed. It resembles an apocalyptic concrete war zone. No cars, no nothing. But thats OK, no traffic and no noise either. There are signs galore of neglect, some carpet stains, coffee mugs in hallways. Just not what you would expect from a Raddison. The first thing I noticed upon entering the room I immediately noticed the lamp shade was missing. Not a good sign. I then gave the room my sanitary inspection. Passed. The bed was clean. Bathroom clean. I stay in a hotel for cleanliness, not for frills. The staff was very friendly. The bathroom was a bit small, but similar to the Choice Inn brand hotels I normally stay in. No free breakfast however, that's a big deal for a budget minded traveler like myself. Overall Id say you'll be happy with this hotel if priced right. I would not have stayed here for $70 bucks had I a choice, but with priceline you dont get any say in which hotel you stay at. I will check around next time Im near Indy airport, but if I have to stay at this hotel for $70, that would be OK. Ive stayed at much worse for this price, much better as well.

Reviews.Title: “Quality of rooms inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: PhyllisColumbus_Ohio
Reviews.Content: The airport location has been changed in Indianapolis, so the Radisson is not in fact very close any more. I am reporting on my second stay at the Radisson. The first time was OK, but the second visit was laughable. I asked for a room that was not near the elevator, and was given one directly across from it. The shower head was hanging from the wall and could not be fixed or adjusted, the handles on the sink faucet were broken and it was hard to stop the water flow, the bathtub was old and in very poor repair and doubtful cleanliness. The toilet tank lid was missing and had been replaced by a piece of wood. I could not reach the front desk on the phone, the information booklet on the desk did not contain any information, and the maid knocked on each door at 8:00 am loudly announcing herself and disturbing those who wanted to rest, something I have never experienced in a hotel before. To be fair, the bed was comfortable and the food in the restaurant was well prepared. However, any hotel that assigns a guest a room such as this can't be depended upon.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe Still a 3* but Risky”
Reviews.Author: Buford1
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Hotel Indianapolis Airport is located at the old airport - about 5 miles from the new airport. Great if you are visiting at Rolls Royce or location close to the airport. Radisson hotels are usually nice and solid 3 star hotels but this one appears to be lacking the usual "keep it nice" on-going maintenance dollars. My room had paint pealing, stains on room ceiling from water leakage above and the bathroom in need of an update. We had rain heavy one night and the place I parked the car was under about six inches of water. I will say it was clean, safe and the staff extra friendly. It had free internet, newspaper if reqested downstairs and plenty of parking. It is very convienent to get to and right off 465. My bet they will keep this running as long as possibel, then sell to a more moderate chain and the star rating will drop to a 2 1/2* within 6 months. I did get a great rate - $50 night - so satisfied with the service and vaue received.

Reviews.Title: “I'm a travel agent and would not suggest to clients.”
Reviews.Author: RACTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Radisson is one of the oldest hotels in the Airport area. In the 70's it was a Hilton, then a Ramada and now a Radisson. It has been many years since my last stay, and since I was in the area for the weekend I thought I would check it out. I arrived early and was unable to get a room in the main tower so I was asked if a non-smoking room in the wing area of the hotel was fine and I said sure. Front desk staff was friendly and the lobby was nice. The rooms in the wing area are a distance from the lobby and you will walk throught the conference room area to get to the wing elevators. I can see that if at night or a woman traveling alone, I would not suggest the wing area of the hotel becuase it is really isolated from the main building. I was on the top/3rd floor & I think I was the only person on the floor which was very nice for me since I don't like a lot of hallway noises. I did notice that the hotel does not have sound proof windows and at times the flight path of flights landing can be very noisy but that does end early evening so It didn't bother me sleeping. The room was very very small. King bed that was nice. The bathroom had to be one of the smallest of any hotel I've stayed. It did look to be clean but you could definately see the age of the hotel through the room layout. The air/heat didn't not work correct and I was up in the middle of the night unable to get the tempeture under control. Between the 2 full service hotels in the airport area, I would recommend my clients to stay at the Adams Mark. If a client did not need full service (room service menu) I would suggest the Hyatt Place Indianapolis Airport. I have never had a bad experience with a Hyatt Place in all my travels.

Reviews.Title: “Very Tired and Not Close to Airport Any Longer”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuyChicago99
Reviews.Content: I had to stay overnight due to a cancelled flight, was directed here by airline and was told that they had a free shuttle. l I should have known that there would be problems when I waited for 20 minutes and had to call a second time to be told that they are on the way. 10 more minutes and they arrived.The hotel is no longer close to the airport. The terminal has been rebuilt on the complete opposite side of the airport requiring a freeway to get there. It took 15 minutes , passing many other hotels.The hotel is very dated with decor from the 80's. The room was not much better, tired in general. The Sleep Number Bed did not work, it just made a lot of noise when trying to adjust. I had dinner in the restaurant and found it also to be a dissapointment. The dining room was very dark and again, outdated. The chair felt like it was going to fall apart at any momemt. The food was overpriced and not that good. Unfortunately there is nothing in the area to walk to, so this is the only option without a car.I could not get hot water in my shower the next morning after many attempts. The front desk staff really didn't care when I told them about it, they appeared to be tired of hearing about complaints. Not sure how this hotel survives, it was not busy and certainly not a place anyone would go back to by choice - not convenient to anything! I'm guessing that it will soon be closed and empty like the old airport terminal next door.I found out why the agents are recommending this hotel - they get some sort of kickback from the hotel for every stranded passenger that they send here! Obviousely this is the only way they can get any business.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rdhingra
Reviews.Content: A well priced great hotel for business traveler. The food was amazing esp the corn tortila soup.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and location at the Radisson Airport”
Reviews.Author: HamptonBrookfield
Reviews.Content: I had to squeeze a quick business trip in between the holidays. I wanted a hotel close to the airport and downtown. The hotel had a very good rate and offerred shuttle service to the airport. The new airport terminal was a little confusing at first ( it appears that the signage is not complete yet) but I eventually found the shuttle area, it is located by the car rental counters. There is a touch screen call board available and I contacted the hotel for pickup. Within minutes a very friendly van driver picked me up. The ride took less than 10 minutes. I was pleasantly surprised with the hotel since some of the other reviews were not so good - this prompted my review. My room was pleasant and I loved the sleep number bed, I actually slept very soundly considering the airport noise outside my window. The room service pizza was also very good and fast. I went out to dinner downtown on my second night and it also was about 10 minutes away. Overall a very nice hotel for the price, I would stay again when in Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “Economy class only”
Reviews.Author: BlueRTA
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the airport Radisson in Indianapolis. Overall, I did not have a great impression of this property. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful, and the cleanliness of my bathroom and bed was OK, but the positives pretty much end there. The carpets in the hallways were dirty and stains were evident on many walls. There were multiple stains on the walls of my room and also a large spider. The wireless Internet worked one night but was very slow and spotty the following night; in addition there was no information on the Internet service in the guest directory. The bathroom was one of the smallest I've ever been in that still featured a tub/shower. In your house you would make it a half bath; when opening the door the bath mat was crushed against the tub and the toilet paper roll was difficult to access since it was under the sink counter. Ironically the sink featured a granite countertop. Also, the elevator to the rooms was very slow and run-down. Overall, this was an experience closer to a "motel" than a "hotel".

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel -- GREAT food”
Reviews.Author: aflane
Reviews.Content: After my flight was cancelled (7 hrs of delays -- they finally gave up), I had to get a hotel room, FAST and more importantly find some food! I had just had a horrible stay at the airport Holiday Inn, and remembered that the Radisson was across the street from the H.I. (I had stayed at the Radisson on other occasions for work.) So while waiting for my bag to be returned to me, I called information and then called the hotel to check on availability -- no problem they said. I caught the shuttle over, but truthfully, I could have walked over. You can see the hotel from the baggage claim area of the airport. I then went to get a room, woefully explaining that my flight had finally been cancelled. I was given the "inconvenienced traveller" rate of $69 which is much less than the normal rate of $119. How nice to NOT be jerked around or ripped off when you've already had a stressful day!! The front desk clerk was very friendly, sympathetic and soothing. Next on my agenda was food. It was around 9:15 p.m. and the restaurant was only open until 10:00 p.m. So, after quickly dumping my bags in my room, I scooted down to the restaurant . I asked if it was too late to be seated for dinner, and was quickly reassured that it was NEVER too late. Again, how nice!! The menu was varied, and even had daily specials. I ordered, and within just a few minutes my appetizer appeared. Fantastic tortilla soup! And the entree that arrived was even better (Tex-Mex grilled shrimp w/pico de gallo on black bean cakes). Don't let the appearance of this restaurant throw you off. It looks like a dim throwback to the mid 1970's, but the kitchen is totally up to date. The food is freshly prepared, and looks and tastes great! Whoever is designing their menus deserves an award. Some out of site stuff is coming out of that kitchen -- NOT your average hotel fare -- and certainly not what you would expect from an airport Radisson. Breakfast the next morning was insanely good (Bananas Foster French Toast). I hope I get stranded again in Indy, so I can eat at the Radisson!!! The hotel room was clean and tidy. Free wi-fi available. If I had to find anything to complain about, I guess it would be that the hot water took a little time to warm up for the shower. Small inconvenience in my opinion. Checkout was a breeze, and I was thanked for my patronage. I think I had to wait an entire 1.5 minutes for the airport shuttle driver to take me over to the airport. Overall summary: The Radisson is NOT a fancy looking hotel. However, you will get a clean room, quite good service, and a fantastic meal there. I'd stay there again, in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here for the convenience only”
Reviews.Author: TheFear
Reviews.Content: Our room was definitely not 3-star worthy. Granted, I got the room for $60 w/ tax at Priceline, but I've had better economy rooms. The TV cable was broken, so all the channels were staticky. We could not get a wireless signal for the free internet. We called to the front desk to have both of these fixed, and while one guy came up to look at the TV but didn't fix it - he claimed a storm had damaged the cable company when minutes before I found that the TV's cable was physically broken on the back of the TV - the internet "engineer" never showed. The beds squeaked, and we were incredibly uncomfortable with that sleep number thing, probably because a double bed is supposed to be for one person, and we had two. Every time one person moved, the other person would go flying like were were in a bounce house or on a trampoline. And the bathroom was a joke. It was tiny, the sink was propped up with a plastic rod, and the toilet wasn't even installed straight, which could have been because the bathroom was so small that they put it at an angle for easier access, but it just looked (and felt) weird. It almost seemed like they put us in a "special" room at the back of the hotel for people who were looking for deals on Priceline, which I guess is their prerogative, but that doesn't mean next time I won't go to the Ramada across the street for less and probably more comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location is the only reason to stay here”
Reviews.Author: ksprott
Reviews.Content: I should start by saying that I only paid $60/night and checked into the hotel at midnight and back out 4 hours later to get to a flight, so it was a brief and inexpensive stay. However, the room was just kind of icky - water damage in the ceiling had caused plaster to hang down, the plumbing around the toilet was old and cruddy-looking, the carpet seemed worn, that kind of thing. Basically, it was the kind of place where my kids and I didn't want to touch anything more than we had to. It couldn't be any closer to the airport, so that is a huge bonus for a tight schedule.

Reviews.Title: “Marginal Airport Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: IndyGirl00
Reviews.Content: If I'd have paid the rack rate for this hotel, I would have been very upset. It was dingy and rundown. The airport noise is horrible. They have the select comfort beds which I found really uncomfortable. It felt like there was a hard railing around the outside of the bed which hurt every time I rolled near it or got in/out of bed. The parking is free (at least during your stay). It's also a very large hotel with ballroom space. My room was on the other side of the ballrooms, so I felt very isolated in the hallway. It actually was the first time I felt unsafe in a hotel. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for single women.

Reviews.Title: “Room Paid For Parking”
Reviews.Author: mrs_shopthe
Reviews.Content: Staff is friendly, rooms are a bit dated and in need of minor repairs. There were not controllers for comfort sleep mattresses. Shower is great, bathroom was clean. Be sure to leave the TV on if the sound of planes bothers you! The cost of the room covered what we would have paid in parking alonem at airport. The shuttle was VERY prompt, drivers friendly and helpful! We would stay again for convenience, not luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Dated, yet still deserving”
Reviews.Author: A_Virginia_Traveler
Reviews.Content: This is your standard close-in airport hotel, where you can practically roll out of bed and find yourself at the gate. In spite of the proximity to the airport, we were not bothered by airplane noise (only occasional sounds of planes flying over, and they weren't very loud). Decor is a bit chintzy and dated, but the rooms seem clean and the beds are comfortable (with the plus of being Radisson's "Sleep Number" bed). Our bathtub looked pretty dingy and in need of repair. The front desk staff were very friendly. The hotel offers free wi-fi in the rooms, which is great. Parking outside is easy and free. This is certainly not a flagship Radisson hotel, but it does its job - a nice clean room for a short stay. We booked our room over Priceline and paid about half the advertised rate.

Reviews.Title: “The worse hotel I ever stayed for this stars!!!”

Nevertheless the reception should help me find the reservation but they couldn't. They couldn't even find by my name, last name or company’s name. which was very strange to me. 2. The reception didn't even asked for apologize that they couldn't find the record. Instead, they gave me stayed in a twin bed room (for a single customer?) and the room was at another building while the elevator was out of order & I have a big suitcase!!!!. when I got in to the room there was no remote for TV worse than that the carpet seem has a lot of dust, bathroom doesn’t meet the staandard!. Sound scary isn't it when everybody heard about this story. 3. I tried to call reception and room service (it was 9-10 pm) but no body answered the phone. Remember that the opposite hotel is a lot better and cheaper

Reviews.Title: “Overdue For A Facelift”
Reviews.Author: KYMark
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel 3 times over the past 10 months. The location is great if you're needing to get to the airport quickly. The biggest issue I have is that the rooms are seriously in need of repair/upgrade. The bathrooms are very small, and everytime I've stayed here I've had either cracked or broken tiles in the shower. There has always been either a water stain on the ceiling or wallpaper/drywall peeling off. On one occasion one of the lampshades looked like it had just finished a battle royale with a very upset cat (and lost). Heating and A/C units seem to work properly about half of the time. I'm wondering if this hotel has so much guaranteed business from the airlines that they just don't worry about maintenance or upkeep.

Reviews.Title: “Closest to the airport, nice stay”
Reviews.Author: campsalot
Reviews.Content: We had an early morning flight, so the location is great as you can walk to the airport. We had friends drop us off so we did not have to worry about parking. Had a nice dinner via room service. I think they upgraded our room as it was more like a suite with a separate living space. I would stay again, if we have an early flight.

Reviews.Title: “No free parking anymore!!”
Reviews.Author: ewatts74
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here in the past because you could park your car without any extra charges while you were on your trip. Not anymore. There was a $10 a night fee. We could have stayed somewhere nicer for alot less money and paid less to park at the airport. I will not stay at this hotel again. It is no longer convenient.

Reviews.Title: “I must have lucked out!”
Reviews.Author: coando
Reviews.Content: I had a Priceline stay at the Radisson March 26th 2006; I paid $40 and was a little worried that I'd get a creepy smoking room in the basement. What I actually got was a friendly and professional greeting at the front desk, and a non smoking room on the 6th floor. My room was fairly large, and so cozy and comfortable with the new, irresistable bedding. I had a great view of the airport runway (yes, the hotel is like a part of the runway), which was fun as the planes came in to land right outside my window-suddenly there would be a huge plane looming thisclose! yet for all the closeness the noise seemed quite minimal and didn't bother me at all. The shower was teensy, but the water pressure was good and strong and steamin' hot. The toilet did an odd ballet of a slow motion flush, but it did it's job and didn't back up as it looked like it might. My only complaint was that the sanitation level was not the highest, there were little bits of things here and there, especially in the hallways, but it wasn't disgusting by any means.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here unless you need to catch a 5:00am flight”
Reviews.Author: sco0437
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after my flight was cancelled. My room on the top floor was large however it had water damage on the ceiling and the tv was 15 feet away from my bed. I dont know how much the rooms go for but I wouldnt pay over 50.00 a night for one. The room service food was very good actually with great service. The best part is that you can walk from the hotel and you are in the airport terminal in 2 minutes. I agree with a previous post as this would compare to a days or holiday inn room..

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Radisson Indianapolis Airport”
Reviews.Author: Circuitboy75
Reviews.Content: TOP NOTCH STAFF. I stayed at the Radisson Indianapolis Airport for a meeting in March. I heard that this location had a renovation and it was beautiful. The staff was very helpful, great attitude and professional. I went to my room and it was to my standards. Top notch accomidations for an airport property. I have stayed downtown before, but this hotel reminds me of a downtown property without the downtown prices. They also just got High Speed internet, at not charge. Perfect, since I had to finish my presentation for the next day. I am very sensitive to other beds, and as a business traveler, I slept better then ever. To top it off, the sales department and banquet staff had a great attitude and were there when I needed them. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants great service at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in January. Not impressed with rooms, staff or restaurant. Food was ok but grossly overpriced. Appears that maintenance department does not exist. All reviewers can't be wrong, if you need to stay near the airport the Holiday Inn Select is right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “If your flight is early - consider it!”
Reviews.Author: snowbiz100
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this location in Mid December. Overall, Its a slightly below average airport hotel. The Lobby area is nice. The rooms are on the “beat up “ side, but you can tell they are trying to keep up with them ( basically the place is old- and the rooms look it). The restaurant is overpriced with average food at best. The lobby bar is nice ( try the Blue Moon with an orange slice). The personnel is friendly and it's less than 5 mins to the airport. If the price looks right and you have an early flight- go for it, if your pretty picky or looking to “hang out" and enjoy the hotel itself... look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “When you are sick you don't care”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the airport sick, I was to be in town for a company held class. The clerk at the airport got me a room at the Radisson and booked me out for a flight home the next day. I was able to pay cash, (I had missplaced my debit/credit card). The room was clean, the staff seemed pleasant. The location of the hotel is great, because you can walk to the hotel from the terminal and when you are ill and just want to go to bed, the closer the better.

Reviews.Title: “GOD AWFUL - STAY NEXT DOOR AT THE HOLIDAY INN!!! TRUST ME”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this dump a number of times in the past. But my last time was the last. Me and my collegue both had the same complaints. Look , first this hotel is grossly mismanaged. The showers and water controls were leaking and looked to be beaten with a sledgehammer (in both of our rooms). Room service over 2 hours late (no one was working there it seemed). The bathrooms were unbelieveable. Don't waste your money there!! I stayed the next night right across the street at the Holiday Inn. Now that's a hotel!!! NICE STAFF, GREAT ROOMS

Reviews.Title: “Ok for one night”
Reviews.Author: pdawg88
Reviews.Content: Would agree with previous post, and would compare to a Days inn. The room was fine, clean carpet, sheets, lobby etc., desk staff friendly. Near the airport terminal, but parked in economy long term lot @ $5.50 per day vs Radisson $10 per day rate. I was surprised being this close to terminal of the lack if any noise we heard from the airport all night long. I would stay there again for overnight if necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoLondon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I picked this hotel because of a 6 a.m. flight. Location-wise, it's right across the street from the terminals. Can't beat it. We were able to walk to the terminal in the morning. The room was in my name. Due to work, my husband and I arrived separately. We have different last names. I was running behind schedule and my husband beat me there. He was able to get a key to the room simply by telling the front desk clerk that he was my husband. Although grateful that he was able to get into the room, I did feel uncomfortable about security issues. The lobby is very nice. The rooms are just okay. They are clean, and comparable to a Days Inn. It did serve the purpose of providing a comfortable room to sleep in for an early morning flight. If we had another early flight, we would definitely stay there again, but only because of sheer convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel experience ever. They gave my reserved room away, along with 30 others who were in town for a conference, shipped us all around town to even more run down hotels, told us our stay would be free then billed my credit card. I did not stay in the hotel because they gave my room away, they charged me anyway. Bad management, employees were not helpful. Daytime staff made promises that night time staff would not keep. All employees complained that this, and things like it, happens often. Employees openly complained about the management of the hotel and that there was nothin they could do. Aviod this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very dirty and run down”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First, the good: Room service was prompt, the food was hot and very good. The front desk clerk was very polite and friendly (Kimberly). The shuttle driver to and from the airport was very sweet and knowledgable.Now, the bad:Checked in, rec'd a key, walked the long distance to my room only to find the key doesn't work. Called the front desk and waited 20 minutes in a stuffy, hot hallway (they do not aircondition the hallways), no-one showed up. Dragged all my bags back down to the front desk, rec'd another key which still didn't work. Was assigned another room, the key worked the first time and then locked me out AGAIN when I went to get a soda.The hallways and elevator had plaster chips tracked all over them and globs of plaster piles dotted the hallways. My room was decorated nicely but the the bathroom was dirty (the toilet had not been flushed), the shower was soap scummy, the wall above the mirror had a hole it it from a previous fixture, the toilet had rust marks in it. The carpet in my room also had plaster chips tracked all around, it made me wonder how long it had been since anyone vacuumed. My pillow smelled like perfume and had makeup on it.The worst part of my entire stay was, I woke up the next morning covered in bite marks that looked like mosquito bites. I sat through a 2 hour meeting the next morning and 2 flights on the way home, itching. My doctor says they are bed bug bites!!!!
